intro: Bunochilus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved bunochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
